trans-unit.source: IS the must attend digital media and creative industries event of 2009, at the Sydney Opera House, 27 to 29 November.

If you are developing digital media ideas across platforms, attend the Professional Conference Day to hear from the world’s best experts, and you can also apply to attend the Lab itself, where you can work with the International Mentors one-on-one to bring your own digital project ideas to market.

XMediaLab Sydney Opera House “Global Media Cultures” will explore the emerging business models, and partnership and growth opportunities for digital media companies across these exciting new markets which have the highest growth rates, the biggest numbers of consumers, the largest youth markets, the greatest emerging talent pools, and increasingly, the financial resources
NED KELLY meets SCI-FI at Loop Space
K-Country, a video work combining comic book narrative with sound and music in a post Brechtian fusion.
{31}Mark Hobby{32} is a Sydney based writer of comic books and Science Fiction as well as a founding member of the Academy of Imaginative Arts.

{33}Stephen Colloff{34} is based in Adelaide and his work has appeared in Pulp Fiction Comic’s Instantaneous Art Exhibition in South Australia and has had work published in the comic anthology, {35}Tango{36}.
Together their work has appeared in the {37}bi- monthly {38}{39}{40}Fistful of Comics{41}{42} anthology.

Mark and Stephen have also been working on a variety of different projects including the soon to be released Graphic Novels{43} K-Country {44}and {45}Tommy Templar, Kid Occultist {46}as well as the creation of a web-comic anthology{47}.

They join together with composer, sound artist{50} {51}and Loop Space co-director{52} Solange Kershaw{53}, drawing on her vast audio experience to recontextualise and establish another dimension to the{54} K-Country {55}story.{56}
An EXCERPT from K-Country sound track and EXAMPLE of what it sounds like when MECH’S rage!!
{57}{58}I feel a metal poker against me head and I know this is the end.{59}{60}

ph.x: <span style="font-family: Times New Roman,Times,serif; font-size: small; font-style: italic;">

trans-unit.source: {61}{62}The crowd goes mad with cries for righteousness and the end to tyranny.

ph.x: <span style="font-family: Times New Roman,Times,serif; font-size: small; font-style: italic;">

trans-unit.source: As if they’re fleshin’ entitled to feel wronged.
Everywhere they go, everything they touch they just gotta control it. {63}{64}

ph.x: <span style="font-family: Times New Roman,Times,serif; font-size: small; font-style: italic;">
<span style="font-family: Times New Roman,Times,serif; font-size: small; font-style: italic;">

trans-unit.source: And they see our freedom as an injustice.
Power is what they crave and its bitter taste is sweetened by audacity.
Not my problem they can’t fleshin’ see that.{71}{72}{73} {74}

ph.x: <em style="font-family: Times New Roman,Times,serif; font-size: small;">
<em style="font-family: Times New Roman,Times,serif; font-size: small;">

trans-unit.source: Ya reckon I’m afraid to die?
Now ya just thinkin’ like a human. {76}
{77}The metal poker cracks the plating of me metal head, I feel it penetrate deep inside me processor as it sears through. {78}

ph.x: <em style="font-family: Times New Roman,Times,serif; font-size: small;">
<em style="font-family: Times New Roman,Times,serif; font-size: small;">

trans-unit.source: Not when you know the rage I know.

I look at the fleshin’ bone walkin’ mob with their soft clay like faces and black pitted eyes, their desire for power playin’ like its justice, I see the truth as clear as the K that pumps through me metal body:{80}

ph.x: <em style="font-family: Times New Roman,Times,serif; font-size: small;">

trans-unit.source: GARDEN OF FORKING PATHS opens at {92}Loop Space{93} as part of Electrofringe.
Electrofringe is Australia‟s largest and most successful festival of electronic arts and culture.
Now in its twelfth year, the 2009 festival has attracted standout local and international artists to its line-up.
Over a huge five days, visitors will experience a convergence of art and technology, ideas and inspirations.
Reaching back to their roots while embarking in new directions, the program of Australian and international artists presents an extravaganza of creativity, encompassing over fifty different events.

{102}image{103}image{104}Thanks to the {105}Sydney Underground Film Festival{106}, d/Lux/MediaArts has 5 double passes to the short film session ‘CINEXPERIMENT 1’ (Friday 11 September 10:15pm) and 5 double passes to the ‘RECYCLED CINEMA’ session (Sunday 13 September at 4:30pm) to giveaway.
{111}The Sydney Underground Film Festival is back for it’s 3rd year, with over twenty sessions and 120+ films.

Highlights include ‘The Yes Men Fix the World’, ‘It Came From Kuchar’, ‘White Lightnin’, ‘Penelope’ and ‘Life with Ashley’, and short film sessions such as ‘Re:animation’, ‘Recycled Cinema’, and ‘Love/Sick’.
The festival takes place from 10 – 13 September 2009 at the Factory Theatre, 105 Victoria Road, Marrickville.
Digital Fringe is now accepting entries
Ferret around your hard drives, dig out those gems and have your work seen on hundreds of public screens.

Uploaded content will play on an extensive network of screens around the world: from retail television display walls to huge urban screens, hospitality venues, galleries, libraries and many other public nooks and crannys.
Visit digitalfringe.com.au to submit your works and for more festival info, or contact them: people@digitalfringe.com.au
Digital Fringe is produced by Horse Bazaar as part of the Melbourne Fringe Festival

trans-unit.source: {57}{58}Face to Face: Portraiture in a Digital Age: National Tour{59}{60}

How have new media and digital technologies changed the way we think about portraiture, identity and faces? What new forms of audience engagement and interaction are made possible by these new technologies?

d/Archive: Featured

FutureScreen Plaything (2003)

Plaything showcased the work of international and Australian artists who explore the language and structure of digital games.

As the gaming industry proliferates, many artists are incorporating various types of gameplay into their practice resulting in new hybrid forms.
